title: China has opened its doors to its $63 billion mega-airport — the biggest single terminal in the world
text:
After a construction period of only four years, Chinese state and party leader Xi Jinping opened the new Daxing International Airport in the capital on Wednesday.

With around 700,000 square meters of building space — comparable to 98 soccer fields — the airport is the largest in the world. It is expected to receive about 170 million passengers by 2025, becoming one of the world's busiest transport hubs.

Read more: A new airport in Poland could become one of the busiest in the world - these design concepts give a first glance at how it could look

The building, designed by Zaha Hadid, has been dubbed the "starfish" because of its six long arms. The total cost, including infrastructure and rail links, cost China a whopping $63 billion, according to Reuters.

Several domestic airlines began operations out of the new mega-airport on Wednesday. International carriers including Cathay Pacific, Finnair, and British Airways have also announced their routes to Daxing.
description: The first commercial flights have taken off from Beijing's new single-terminal international airport dubbed the "starfish."
